humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that one sentinel lymph node (Lymph Node #1, Right) was found to have metastatic carcinoma, with a metastatic focus of 1.2 cm in greatest diameter and extracapsular extension of 0.5 cm x 0.2 cm. This information corresponds to the N1 stage as per the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12). Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for pathologic staging is based on the assessment of lymph node involvement in cancer. In this report, the pathologic N stage can be determined from Part 4, which describes the sentinel lymph node biopsy from the right side. It indicates the presence of metastatic carcinoma involving one lymph node with a metastatic focus of 1.2 cm in greatest diameter and extracapsular extension of 0.5 cm x 0.2 cm. Therefore, the pathologic N stage is N1.
